etymology.description: pictogram: a net; top web stylized as 罒 (unrelated to 目). Trad: phono-semantic—semantic 糸 (“rope/silk”) + phonetic 罔.
etymology.interpretation: Depicts a woven mesh, with the lattice of cords suggested by the frame-like 罒 at the top, which is not the eye component. The traditional form augments the meaning with the silk/thread element and borrows 罔 for sound.
etymology.simplification: Simplified by adopting an ancient pictographic form, dropping the 糸 semantic and the phonetic 罔 to reduce strokes while preserving the net imagery.

examples.chinese: 他把渔网撒向水面(他把漁網撒向水面)。
examples.pinyin: Tā bǎ yúwǎng sǎ xiàng shuǐmiàn.
examples.english: He cast the fishing net onto the water’s surface.

examples.chinese: 这张网很结实，可以捕捉很多鱼(這張網很結實，可以捕捉很多魚)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè zhāng wǎng hěn jiéshi, kěyǐ bǔzhuō hěn duō yú.
examples.english: This net is sturdy and can catch many fish.

examples.chinese: 晚上我上网查资料(晚上我上網查資料)。
examples.pinyin: Wǎnshang wǒ shàng wǎng chá zīliào.
examples.english: At night I go online to look up information.
